reasoning: 1. Circle of Competence: Amazon sits outside my sweet spot. I know simple retailing, insurance, banks and candy shops — not multi-headed beasts juggling e-commerce, cloud services, logistics, media and advertising all at once. Risk comes from not knowing what you’re doing, and this one’s too complex for my playbook. 2. Moat: There’s no doubt Amazon boasts scale, Prime membership lock-in and AWS pricing power, but wide doesn’t always mean deep. Its inconsistent ROE (only zero out of ten years above 15%) suggests the moat isn’t as durable as it appears. 3. Management & Capital Allocation: Bezos and Jassy have shown grit and vision, yet they plow every dollar back into growth rather than return cash to shareholders. No dividends and no share repurchases leave little margin of safety. 4. Financial Health & Consistency: A debt-to-equity north of 2.0, uneven earnings growth and spotty returns on invested capital point to a financial fortress that’s more paper than rock. 5. Valuation vs Intrinsic Value: The three-stage DCF spits out a negative intrinsic value and a margin of safety at –115%. Paying up for hope isn’t my style — I want a wonderful business at a fair price, not the other way around. 6. Long-Term Prospects: I’m sure e-commerce and cloud will keep humming, but tougher competition, rising costs and regulatory scrutiny could erode any lead Amazon has. 7. Comparison to My Portfolio: I’d rather own Coca-Cola or Apple — businesses I deeply understand, with predictable cash flows, solid moats and reasonable valuations. So when in doubt, I say no.

fundamental_analysis.details: Weak ROE of 10.4%; High debt to equity ratio of 2.0; Strong operating margins; Current ratio data not available

consistency_analysis.details: Inconsistent earnings growth pattern; Total earnings growth of 571.2% over past 10 periods

moat_analysis.details: Inconsistent ROE: only 0/10 periods >15%; Strong and stable operating margins (avg: 47.8%) indicate pricing power moat; High performance stability (79.7%) suggests strong competitive moat

book_value_analysis.details: Consistent book value per share growth (Buffett's favorite metric); Good book value CAGR: 10.1%

management_analysis.details: No significant new stock issuance detected; No or minimal dividends paid

details: Using three-stage DCF: Stage 1 (8.0%, 5y), Stage 2 (4.0%, 5y), Terminal (2.5%)
